standards: 5.1.1 Read and write numbers up to 1,000,000 in numerals and words
objectives: Students will be able to read and write numbers up to 1,000,000 in numeral and word forms correctly.
activities: Singing number songs up to 1,000,000
Writing numbers from words to numerals (e.g., 'six hundred thousand and thirty-five' → 600,035)
'Find the Number' game – locating numbers on a large chart
aids: Number word cards (million, thousand, hundred, ten, one)

standards: 5.1.2 Comparing and arranging numbers up to 1,000,000
objectives: Students will be able to compare two numbers up to 1,000,000 and arrange them in ascending or descending order.
activities: Arranging number cards in order
'Largest Number' game – comparing numbers in groups
Using base-ten blocks to demonstrate place value
assessment: Worksheet: Arranging numbers in ascending/descending order
aids: Base-ten blocks (million, hundred thousand, ten thousand, thousand, hundred, ten, one)

standards: 5.2.1 Solve mixed operations without brackets following the order of operations (BODMAS)
objectives: Students will be able to solve mixed mathematical sentences (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) without brackets according to the order of operations (BODMAS).
activities: Using a BODMAS chart to show the order
Solving questions step-by-step
'Who is Faster?' game – solving mathematical sentences within a time limit
assessment: Observation of the use of order of operations
unit: Unit 2: Basic Operations (Mixed Operations up to 1,000,000)
kategori: Mixed Operations Following the Order of Operations (BODMAS)

standards: 5.2.2 Solve mixed operations with brackets following the order of operations (BODMAS)
objectives: Students will be able to solve mixed mathematical sentences with brackets according to the order of operations (BODMAS).
activities: Using mathematical sentence cards with brackets
'Open Brackets First' activity – solving the parts inside brackets first
Solving daily life problems: '(4 + 3) × 5 = ?'
unit: Unit 2: Basic Operations (Mixed Operations up to 1,000,000)
kategori: Mixed Operations Following the Order of Operations (BODMAS)

standards: 5.3.1 Multiply proper fractions with whole numbers
objectives: Students will be able to solve the multiplication of proper fractions with whole numbers using visual models or algorithms.
activities: Using paper circles to demonstrate fraction multiplication
Drawing and coloring sections to show the product
Solving daily life problems: '½ × 4 = ?'

standards: 5.3.2 Divide proper fractions by whole numbers
objectives: Students will be able to solve the division of proper fractions by whole numbers using models or algorithms.
activities: Using fraction cards to show division
Dividing one part into several equal parts
Solving daily life problems: '⅔ ÷ 3 = ?'

standards: 5.4.1 Multiply decimals up to three decimal places with whole numbers
objectives: Students will be able to solve the multiplication of decimals up to three decimal places with whole numbers using algorithms or grids.
activities: Using decimal grids to show multiplication
Writing mathematical sentences on the board
'Decimal Multiply' game in pairs

standards: 5.4.2 Divide decimals up to three decimal places by whole numbers
objectives: Students will be able to solve the division of decimals up to three decimal places by whole numbers using algorithms or base-ten blocks.
activities: Using base-ten blocks to show the division process
'Share Equally' activity – dividing decimals into several parts
Solving daily life problems: '3.6 ÷ 4 = ?'

standards: 5.5.1 Calculate the percentage value of a quantity (e.g., 20% of 500)
objectives: Students will be able to calculate the percentage value of a quantity using the method of converting percentages to fractions or decimals.
activities: Using a 100-grid to show percentages of a quantity
Solving daily life problems: '15% discount off RM80'
'Calculate Percent' game – calculating percentages within a time limit
unit: Unit 5: Percentages (Percentage Value of a Quantity)
kategori: Calculating Percentage Value of a Quantity

standards: 5.5.2 Solve daily life problems involving percentage values of a quantity
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily situations such as discounts, taxes, or price increases using percentage values of a quantity.
activities: Roleplay: 'Original price RM100, 25% discount, what is the final price?'
Using percentage problem story cards
'Discount Store' game in groups
unit: Unit 5: Percentages (Percentage Value of a Quantity)
kategori: Calculating Percentage Value of a Quantity

standards: 5.6.1 Understand the concepts of money management, profit, and loss
objectives: Students will be able to understand the meaning of money management, profit (selling price > cost price), and loss (selling price < cost price).
activities: Shop game: buying items, reselling, and calculating profit/loss
Using story cards to describe profit/loss situations
Creating a daily money management schedule
kategori: Concepts of Money Management, Profit & Loss

standards: 5.6.2 Solve daily life problems involving profit and loss
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily situations such as calculating profit or loss in a small business using addition/subtraction operations.
activities: Roleplay: 'Buy a book for RM5, sell for RM7, how much profit?'
Using profit/loss problem story cards
'Mini Business' game in pairs
kategori: Concepts of Money Management, Profit & Loss

standards: 5.7.1 Perform multiplication operations involving time units (hours, minutes, days)
objectives: Students will be able to solve multiplication mathematical sentences involving hours, minutes, and days (e.g., 2 hours 30 minutes × 3).
activities: Using analog clocks and calendars to show time multiplication
'Multiply Time' game – multiplying time in groups
Solving daily life problems: 'Exercise 1 hour 15 minutes every day, 5 days = ?'
kategori: Multiplication & Division Operations of Time Units

standards: 5.7.2 Perform division operations involving time units (hours, minutes, days)
objectives: Students will be able to solve division mathematical sentences involving hours, minutes, and days (e.g., 5 hours 30 minutes ÷ 3).
activities: Using analog clocks and calendars to show time division
'Divide Time' game – dividing time in pairs
Solving daily life problems: 'An 8-hour project, 4 people, how much time for each person?'
kategori: Multiplication & Division Operations of Time Units

standards: 5.8.1 Convert units of measurement (km to m, liter to ml) and solve problems involving fractions
objectives: Students will be able to convert units of measurement (e.g., 2.5 km = 2500 m) and solve problems involving fractions in measurements.
activities: Using unit conversion charts to show relationships
Solving daily life problems: 'A road is 3½ km long, how many meters?'
'Quick Conversion' game – converting units within a time limit
unit: Unit 8: Measurement (Length, Mass, Volume of Liquid - involving Fractions & Decimals)

standards: 5.8.2 Solve problems involving decimals in measurement (length, mass, volume of liquid)
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily life problems involving decimals in measurement (e.g., 2.75 kg + 1.5 kg).
activities: Measuring objects and recording in decimals
Weighing and pouring liquids, calculating totals in decimals
Solving daily life problems: '1.25 L water + 0.75 L = ?'
unit: Unit 8: Measurement (Length, Mass, Volume of Liquid - involving Fractions & Decimals)

standards: 5.9.1 Calculate the volume of a cuboid using the formula (length × width × height)
objectives: Students will be able to calculate the volume of a cuboid using the formula or base-ten block method.
activities: Using base-ten blocks to build a cuboid and calculate volume
Measuring cuboid dimensions and calculating volume
Solving daily life problems: 'A box 10cm x 5cm x 3cm, what is its volume?'
kategori: Calculating Volume of a Cuboid and Daily Life Problems

standards: 5.9.2 Solve daily life problems involving volume of a cuboid
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily situations such as filling water in a bathtub or box using cuboid volume.
activities: Roleplay: 'A bathtub 2m x 1m x 0.5m, how many liters of water?'
Using volume problem story cards
'Calculate Volume' game in pairs
kategori: Calculating Volume of a Cuboid and Daily Life Problems

standards: 5.10.1 Calculate the average (mean) for a set of data (length, mass, volume of liquid)
objectives: Students will be able to calculate the average (mean) for a set of data (e.g., length of 3 pencils) using the formula (sum ÷ number of items).
activities: Measuring the length of 5 pencils and calculating the average
Weighing 4 objects and calculating the average mass
Pouring 3 containers of liquid and calculating the average volume
assessment: Observation of measurement and calculation accuracy
unit: Unit 10: Data Analysis (Average for Length, Mass, Volume of Liquid)

standards: 5.10.2 Solve daily life problems involving average
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily situations such as average test scores or average body weight using the concept of average.
activities: Roleplay: 'Test scores 80, 90, 70, 85, what is the average?'
Using average problem story cards
'Calculate Average' game in pairs
unit: Unit 10: Data Analysis (Average for Length, Mass, Volume of Liquid)

standards: 5.11.1 Calculate interior angles of regular polygons (triangles, quadrilaterals, pentagons, etc.)
objectives: Students will be able to calculate the interior angles of regular polygons using a formula or circle division method (360° ÷ number of sides).
activities: Using a protractor to measure interior angles
Constructing regular polygons and calculating interior angles
Solving daily life problems: 'Interior angle of a regular hexagon = ?'
unit: Unit 11: Polygons (Interior Angles of Regular Polygons)
kategori: Calculating Interior Angles of Regular Polygons

standards: 5.11.2 Solve daily life problems involving interior angles of regular polygons
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily situations such as tile arrangement or designs using interior angles of regular polygons.
activities: Roleplay: 'A square tile, what is the interior angle?'
Using interior angle problem story cards
'Design' game – drawing regular polygons and labeling angles
unit: Unit 11: Polygons (Interior Angles of Regular Polygons)
kategori: Calculating Interior Angles of Regular Polygons

standards: 5.12.1 Identify and measure angles on a straight line (180°)
objectives: Students will be able to identify and measure angles on a straight line (180°) using a protractor.
activities: Using a protractor to measure angles on a straight line
Finding angles on straight lines in the surroundings
'Measure Straight Angle' game – measuring angles on cards
assessment: Worksheet: Measuring angles on a straight line
unit: Unit 12: Lines and Angles (Angles on a Straight Line, Reflex Angles)
kategori: Understanding Angles on a Straight Line & Reflex Angles

standards: 5.12.2 Identify and measure reflex angles (>180°)
objectives: Students will be able to identify and measure reflex angles (>180°) using a protractor.
activities: Drawing reflex angles and measuring them
Finding reflex angles in textbooks and measuring them
'Guess the Reflex Angle' game – teacher shows an angle, student guesses and measures
assessment: Worksheet: Labeling and measuring reflex angles
Oral Q&A: 'What type of angle is this and how many degrees?'
unit: Unit 12: Lines and Angles (Angles on a Straight Line, Reflex Angles)
kategori: Understanding Angles on a Straight Line & Reflex Angles

standards: 5.13.1 Understand the concept of ratio as a comparison of two quantities
objectives: Students will be able to understand ratio as a comparison of two quantities (e.g., 2:3) using visual models or concrete objects.
activities: Using colored marbles to show ratios (2 red : 3 blue)
Matching ratio cards with images
'Find the Ratio' game – finding ratios in groups
kategori: Understanding Concepts of Ratio and Rate

standards: 5.13.2 Understand the concept of rate as a ratio between two quantities with different units
objectives: Students will be able to understand rate as a ratio between two quantities with different units (e.g., 60 km/h, 5 pieces/RM1).
activities: Using story cards to show rates (speed, unit price)
Solving daily life problems: 'Car speed 80 km/h, 2 hours = ? km'
'Fast Rate' game – calculating rates within a time limit
kategori: Understanding Concepts of Ratio and Rate

standards: 5.14.1 Solve simple problems involving proportion (e.g., if 2 items are RM1, 6 items = ?)
objectives: Students will be able to solve daily life problems involving proportion using multiplication or division methods.
activities: Using story cards to show proportion
Solving daily life problems: '3 apples RM6, 5 apples = ?'
'Calculate Price' game – calculating price based on rates

standards: 5.14.2 Use the cross-multiplication method to solve proportion problems
objectives: Students will be able to use the cross-multiplication method to solve proportion problems (e.g., 2/3 = x/6, find x).
activities: Using a cross-multiplication method chart
Solving questions step-by-step
'Quick Cross Multiply' game – solving within a time limit

standards: 5.15.1 Understand the concept of positive and negative decimals on a number line
objectives: Students will be able to understand and show positive and negative decimals on a number line (e.g., -0.5, +1.5).
activities: Using a number line to show positive/negative decimals
Drawing number lines and marking decimal points
'Find the Point' game – teacher says the value, student marks it

standards: 5.15.2 Add and subtract positive and negative decimals
objectives: Students will be able to add and subtract positive and negative decimals using a number line or algorithm.
activities: Using a number line to show decimal addition/subtraction
Solving daily life problems: 'Morning temperature -2.5°C, rose 4.5°C, what is it now?'
'Decimal Add-Subtract' game in pairs

standards: 5.16.1 Construct a pie chart based on collected data
objectives: Students will be able to construct a pie chart using collected data and determine the angle of each sector (e.g., 100% = 360°).
activities: Collecting data on classmates' favorite colors
Calculating the angle of each sector (e.g., 25% = 90°)
Constructing a pie chart using paper circles and protractors
unit: Unit 16: Data Management (Pie Charts, Data Analysis)

standards: 5.16.2 Interpret information from a pie chart
objectives: Students will be able to read and interpret information from a pie chart (e.g., most popular color, percentage who like blue).
activities: Interpreting self-constructed pie charts
Q&A: 'Which is the most?', 'What percentage likes red?'
'Guess the Answer' game based on charts
unit: Unit 16: Data Management (Pie Charts, Data Analysis)

standards: 5.17.1 Understand probability as a measure of the likelihood of an event occurring
objectives: Students will be able to understand probability as a measure of the likelihood of an event occurring (e.g., impossible, less likely, likely, very likely, certain).
activities: Using event cards to show levels of probability
'Guess the Likelihood' game – guessing the probability of daily events
Constructing a probability chart (impossible → certain)
assessment: Oral assessment: 'What is the likelihood of rain today?'

standards: 5.17.2 Determine simple probability based on experiments
objectives: Students will be able to determine simple probability based on experiments (e.g., rolling a die, what is the chance of getting a 4).
activities: Rolling a die 20 times and recording results
Calculating the probability of a specific number appearing
'Probability Dice' game – guessing the chance of a number appearing
